<a id="AnimationNodeAnimation"></a>

# AnimationNodeAnimation

**Inherits:** [AnimationRootNode](AnimationRootNode.md) **\<** [AnimationNode](AnimationNode.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

An input animation for an [AnimationNodeBlendTree](AnimationNodeBlendTree.md).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A resource to add to an [AnimationNodeBlendTree](AnimationNodeBlendTree.md). Only has one output port using the [animation](AnimationNodeAnimation.md#AnimationNodeAnimation_property_animation) property. Used as an input for [AnimationNode](AnimationNode.md)\\ s that blend animations together.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [Using AnimationTree](../tutorials/animation/animation_tree.md)

- [3D Platformer Demo](https://godotengine.org/asset-library/asset/2748)

- [Third Person Shooter (TPS) Demo](https://godotengine.org/asset-library/asset/2710)

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="AnimationNodeAnimation_property_advance_on_start"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **advance_on_start** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#AnimationNodeAnimation_property_advance_on_start)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_advance_on_start**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_advance_on_start**\ (\ )

If ``true``, on receiving a request to play an animation from the start, the first frame is not drawn, but only processed, and playback starts from the next frame.

See also the notes of [AnimationPlayer.play()](AnimationPlayer.md#AnimationPlayer_method_play).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimationNodeAnimation_property_animation"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[StringName](StringName.md) **animation** = `&""` [ðŸ”—](#AnimationNodeAnimation_property_animation)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_animation**\ (\ value\: [StringName](StringName.md)\ )
- [StringName](StringName.md) **get_animation**\ (\ )

Animation to use as an output. It is one of the animations provided by [AnimationTree.anim_player](AnimationTree.md#AnimationTree_property_anim_player).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimationNodeAnimation_property_loop_mode"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[LoopMode](Animation.md#enum_Animation_LoopMode) **loop_mode** [ðŸ”—](#AnimationNodeAnimation_property_loop_mode)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_loop_mode**\ (\ value\: [LoopMode](Animation.md#enum_Animation_LoopMode)\ )
- [LoopMode](Animation.md#enum_Animation_LoopMode) **get_loop_mode**\ (\ )

If [use_custom_timeline](AnimationNodeAnimation.md#AnimationNodeAnimation_property_use_custom_timeline) is ``true``, override the loop settings of the original [Animation](Animation.md) resource with the value.

\ **Note:** If the [Animation.loop_mode](Animation.md#Animation_property_loop_mode) isn't set to looping, the [Animation.track_set_interpolation_loop_wrap()](Animation.md#Animation_method_track_set_interpolation_loop_wrap) option will not be respected. If you cannot get the expected behavior, consider duplicating the [Animation](Animation.md) resource and changing the loop settings.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimationNodeAnimation_property_play_mode"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[PlayMode](AnimationNodeAnimation.md#enum_AnimationNodeAnimation_PlayMode) **play_mode** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#AnimationNodeAnimation_property_play_mode)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_play_mode**\ (\ value\: [PlayMode](AnimationNodeAnimation.md#enum_AnimationNodeAnimation_PlayMode)\ )
- [PlayMode](AnimationNodeAnimation.md#enum_AnimationNodeAnimation_PlayMode) **get_play_mode**\ (\ )

Determines the playback direction of the animation.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimationNodeAnimation_property_start_offset"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **start_offset** [ðŸ”—](#AnimationNodeAnimation_property_start_offset)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_start_offset**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_start_offset**\ (\ )

If [use_custom_timeline](AnimationNodeAnimation.md#AnimationNodeAnimation_property_use_custom_timeline) is ``true``, offset the start position of the animation.

This is useful for adjusting which foot steps first in 3D walking animations.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimationNodeAnimation_property_stretch_time_scale"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **stretch_time_scale** [ðŸ”—](#AnimationNodeAnimation_property_stretch_time_scale)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_stretch_time_scale**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_stretching_time_scale**\ (\ )

If ``true``, scales the time so that the length specified in [timeline_length](AnimationNodeAnimation.md#AnimationNodeAnimation_property_timeline_length) is one cycle.

This is useful for matching the periods of walking and running animations.

If ``false``, the original animation length is respected. If you set the loop to [loop_mode](AnimationNodeAnimation.md#AnimationNodeAnimation_property_loop_mode), the animation will loop in [timeline_length](AnimationNodeAnimation.md#AnimationNodeAnimation_property_timeline_length).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimationNodeAnimation_property_timeline_length"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **timeline_length** [ðŸ”—](#AnimationNodeAnimation_property_timeline_length)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_timeline_length**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_timeline_length**\ (\ )

If [use_custom_timeline](AnimationNodeAnimation.md#AnimationNodeAnimation_property_use_custom_timeline) is ``true``, offset the start position of the animation.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimationNodeAnimation_property_use_custom_timeline"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **use_custom_timeline** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#AnimationNodeAnimation_property_use_custom_timeline)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_use_custom_timeline**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_using_custom_timeline**\ (\ )

If ``true``, [AnimationNode](AnimationNode.md) provides an animation based on the [Animation](Animation.md) resource with some parameters adjusted.
